newsitem.title: PHILIPPINES: Philippine end-96 preliminary BOP surplus $4.2 bln.
newsitem.headline: Philippine end-96 preliminary BOP surplus $4.2 bln.

text.p: The Philippines posted a preliminary balance of payments surplus of $4.2 billion by the end of last year, Central Bank research director Diwa Gunigundo said on Wednesday.
The surplus was higher than the $4.0 billion target set by the Central Bank. The surplus stood at $631 million by the end of 1995.
The Central Bank attributed the rise to the influx of foreign investments and loans during the year.
The breakdown was not immediately available.
